clinical_study.brief_title: Growth of Preterm Infants Fed a Infant Milk Formula Containing High Versus Low Amounts of Beta-palmitate
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multicenter, Controlled Clinical Trial to Assess Weight Gain of Preterm Infants Fed a New Infant Milk Formula Containing High Amounts of Beta-palmitate Versus a Standard Infant Milk Formula Containing Low Amounts of Beta-palmitate

collaborator.agency: Istituto di Ricerca Pediatrica Città della Speranza

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to assess weight gain of preterm infants (gestational age lower than 32 weeks) fed infant milk formula with about 60% beta-palmitate (EX_IMF) vs infant milk formula with similar macronutrient, mineral and fatty acid composition but lower amounts of beta-palmitate (ST_IMF). Own mother milk (OMM) fed infants will serve as reference group.

detailed_description.textblock:
A large number of low birth weight infants during their hospital stay experience poor growth and this has been linked to reduced neurodevelopment scores.
Several enriched infant milk formulas are available for preterm infants who cannot be fed human milk. The use of infant milk formulas (IMF) enriched with triglycerides similar to human milk lipids have shown to be associated with better fatty acid and mineral intestinal absorption.
In this multicenter, randomized, controlled clinical trial, preterm infants (gestational age lower than 32 weeks), who can not be fed human milk, will be randomized to receive IMF with high or low amounts of beta-palmitate (about 60% vs 10%, respectively). A non-randomized own human milk-fed group will be included as a reference. Patients will be on the study diet as soon as possible after birth and till 36 weeks of gestation. Neurodevelopment follow-up will be performed at 24 months corrected age.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
primary_outcome.description: Body weight will be daily measured by using an electronic balance (g/kg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For 1 consecutive day at 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Crying duration will be electronically recorded by a unidirectional microphone (hours/day).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: For 1 consecutive day at 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before..
secondary_outcome.description: The number of spontaneous movements per hour will be electronically measured by Kinect system.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Stooling pattern will be reported by the parents according to on the Bristol stool form scale (consistency).

secondary_outcome.measure: Stool biochemical composition - Total fatty acids
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Total fatty acids in the stool samples will be measured by gas chromatography (mg/g of dry feces).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Palmitic acid in the stool samples will be measured by gas chromatography (mg/g of dry feces).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Fecal calcium will be measured by inductively coupled plasma emission spectrometry.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Fecal phosphorus will be measured by inductively coupled plasma emission spectrometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Fecal magnesium will be measured by inductively coupled plasma emission spectrometry.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Fecal hydroxylic acids will be measured by high-resolution capillary chromatography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative infants formulas intakes (mL/kg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative human milk intakes (mL/kg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative parenteral nutrition intakes (mL/kg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative intravenous amino acid intakes (g/kg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative intravenous glucose intakes (g/kg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative intravenous lipid intakes (g/kg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of parenteral nutrition (days)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary dicarboxylic acids will be measured by gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (mmol/mol of creatinine).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before and then at 24 months of corrected age..
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight will be measured by using an electronic balance (grams).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before and then at 24 months of corrected age.
secondary_outcome.description: Total body length will be measured by using a stadiometer (cm).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before and then at 24 months of corrected age.
secondary_outcome.description: Head circumference will be measured by using a unstretchable tape (cm).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Glucose concentrations in blood (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Triglyceride concentrations in blood (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma cholesterol by gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma phospholipids by gas chromatography (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma total fatty acids by gas chromatography (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Urea concentrations in plasma (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 7 and 42 days of postnatal age.
secondary_outcome.description: Total and conjugated bilirubin concentrations (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Na+, K+, Ca2+, Cl- and standard base excess (mmol/L).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Calcium concentrations in blood (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: phosphorus concentrations in blood (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Total body water (% of body weight) will be measured by the deuterium dilution method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of bifidobacteria per gram of feces will be measured by using fluorescent in situ hybridization.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of gastrointestinal problems such as abdominal distension, gastric residuals, reflux and vomiting.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of death during the hospital stay.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of complications of prematurity such as respiratory distress syndrome (RDS), necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC), patent ductus arteriosus (PDA), intraventricular hemorrhage (IVH), retinopathy of prematurity (ROP), bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD), Periventricular Leukomalacia (PVL), sepsis, and cholestasis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 24 months of corrected age.
secondary_outcome.description: Neurodevelopment will be assessed by the Bayley test III.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Urea concentrations in urine (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Calcium concentrations in urine (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Phosphorus concentrations in urine (mg/dL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma alkaline phosphatase (ALP, IU/L), aspartate transaminase (AST, IU/L), alanine aminotransferase (ALT, IU/L) and gamma glutamyltranspeptidase concentrations (γ-GT, IU/L).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 32, 34 and then at 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: Parathyroid hormone concentrations in blood (pg/mL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily from birth to 36 weeks of gestational age or until discharge if this occurred before.
secondary_outcome.description: hypo/hypernatremia, hypo/hyperkalemia, hypo/hyperchloremia, hypo/hypercalcemia, hypo/hyperparathyroidism, metabolic acidosis, hypo/hyperglycaemia, hypertriglyceridemia and elevated urea.

arm_group.description: Infants will receive infants formula with large amounts of beta-palmitate (EX_IMF).
Infants will receive infants formula with low amounts of beta-palmitate (ST_IMF).

intervention.description: Infant formula with large amounts of beta-palmitate (about 60%).
Infant formula with low amounts beta-palmitate (about 10%).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- gestational age between 24 and 32 weeks of gestation at enrollment,
- birth weight greater than 750 grams,
- singleton or twin birth (no triplet or higher),
- fraction of inspired oxygen lower than 0.60 at enrollment,
- feasible enteral feeding,
- cardiovascular stable condition,
- informed consent form signed by at least one parent or legal guardian.
Exclusion Criteria:
- congenital malformations, genetic, metabolic and endocrine disorders,
- suspicious infection at enrollment,
- intrauterine growth restriction (<10th centile) at enrollment,
- maternal diabetes requiring insulin therapy,
- neonatal asphyxia.
